fr.sorbonne_u.cps.dht_mapreduce.interfaces.mapreduce

Interface MapReduceSyncI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MapReduceSyncCI

    public interface MapReduceSyncI
    The interface MapReduceSyncI defines the methods implementing the map and the reduce computations over the DHT.

    Description

    This interface is used as an implementation interface for nodes in the DHT providing a map/reduce facility over the entries of the DHT. The computation is done in two phases: first the map traverses the DHT nodes and then the reduce. To enable a parallelism between the map/reduce computations, an URI is attributed to each request so that the implementation can use it to perform the DHT-wise operation and store intermediate results. The signature clearMapReduceComputation provides for a way to clean up any remaining intermediate data used to compute a request after it has terminated.

    As indicated by the suffix Sync on the signature names, this map/reduce interface imposes that the computations for the map and the reduce will be executed through synchronous calls i.e., callers are suspended until the results come back from the callee, like in standard sequential method calls.

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2024-06-04

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearMapReduceComputation(java.lang.String computationURI)
      clear the map/reduce computation from the data structures of the DHT after is has been completed.
      <R extends java.io.Serializable>
      void      		 mapSync(java.lang.String computationURI, SelectorI selector, ProcessorI<R> processor)
      map the processor computation over the entries in the DHT that passes the selector test.
      <A extends java.io.Serializable,R>
      A      		 reduceSync(java.lang.String computationURI, ReductorI<A,R> reductor, CombinatorI<A> combinator, A currentAcc)
      synchronously reduce the results of type R from a previously executed map with URI computationURI using an accumulator of type A; reductor is the function that computes a new accumulator value from the previous one and a map result while combinator is the function that computes a new accumulator value from two previous accumulator values.

    • Method Detail

      • mapSync

        <R extends java.io.Serializable> void mapSync(java.lang.String computationURI,
                                              SelectorI selector,
                                              ProcessorI<R> processor)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        map the processor computation over the entries in the DHT that passes the selector test.

        Contract

         pre     computationURI != null && !computationURI.isEmpty()
 pre     selector != null
 pre     processor != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Type Parameters:
        R - type of the results of the map computation.
        Parameters:
        computationURI - URI of the computation, used to distinguish parallel maps over the same DHT.
        selector - a boolean function that selects the entries in the DHT that will be processed by the map.
        processor - a function implementing the processing to be mapped itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

      • reduceSync

        <A extends java.io.Serializable,R> A reduceSync(java.lang.String computationURI,
                                                ReductorI<A,R> reductor,
                                                CombinatorI<A> combinator,
                                                A currentAcc)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        synchronously reduce the results of type R from a previously executed map with URI computationURI using an accumulator of type A; reductor is the function that computes a new accumulator value from the previous one and a map result while combinator is the function that computes a new accumulator value from two previous accumulator values.

        Contract

         pre     computationURI != null && !computationURI.isEmpty()
 pre     reductor != null
 pre     combinator != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Type Parameters:
        R - type of the results in the map computation.
        A - type of the accumulator in the reduction computation.
        Parameters:
        computationURI - URI of the computation, used to distinguish parallel maps over the same DHT.
        reductor - function A x R -> A accumulating one map result.
        combinator - function A x A -> A combining two accumulators.
        currentAcc - the initial accumulator value.
        Returns:
        the final accumulator after all reductions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
